alert.note: Alert for Noble (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 26 at 9:48PM CST until February 26 at 10:45PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CST FOR KAY...NORTHEASTERN KINGFISHER...NOBLE...SOUTHEASTERN GRANT... NORTHWESTERN LOGAN AND EASTERN GARFIELD COUNTIES... At 947 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southwest of Blackwell to near Billings to 4 miles east of Covington to near Marshall, moving east at 85 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR BLACKWELL, BILLINGS, PERRY. HAZARD...90 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged or destroyed. Homes and businesses will have substantial roof and window damage. Expect extensive tree damage and power outages. Locations impacted include... Ponca City, Blackwell, Perry, Tonkawa, Newkirk, Garber, Covington, Billings, Lamont, Kaw City, Red Rock, Marshall, Breckenridge, Marland, Hunter, Fairmont, Kildare, Douglas, Kaw Lake and Nardin. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...90 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
